p: The current research has been carried out to: (i) investigate the chemical composition of S. canadensis EO growing in the wild in Slovakia using gas chromatography-mass spectrometry (GC-MS); (ii) evaluate the antimicrobial activity against some post-harvest phytopathogenic fungi ( Monilinia fructicola, Botrytis cinerea, Aspergillus niger, and Penicillium expansum) and also against some phytopathogenic bacteria ( Bacillus megaterium and Clavibacter michiganensis (G+ve), Xanthomonas campestris, Pseudomonas fluorescens, and Pseudomonas syringae pv. phaseolicola (Gâˆ’ve), and evaluating the minimum inhibitory concentration (MIC)); and (iii) screen the biological mode of action of S. canadensis EO by carrying out a cell membrane permeability assay (CMP).
